articles.headline: Counties That Suffered Higher Unemployment Rates Voted for Biden
articles.snippet: The counties won by Joe Biden experienced worse job losses, on average, during the initial wave of pandemic layoffs than the counties where President Trump was strongest.
articles.abstract: The counties won by Joe Biden experienced worse job losses, on average, during the initial wave of pandemic layoffs than the counties where President Trump was strongest.
articles.lead_paragraph: The counties won by Joe Biden experienced worse job losses, on average, during the initial wave of pandemic layoffs than the counties where President Trump was strongest.

articles.headline: Hungary and Poland Threaten E.U. Stimulus Over Rule of Law Links
articles.snippet: The two illiberal governments, having been enabled by the bloc’s leaders and evaded punishment, now hold a 1.8 trillion euro package hostage.
articles.abstract: The two illiberal governments, having been enabled by the bloc’s leaders and evaded punishment, now hold a 1.8 trillion euro package hostage.
articles.lead_paragraph: BRUSSELS — When European Union leaders announced a landmark stimulus package to rescue their economies from the ravages of the coronavirus, they agreed to jointly raise hundreds of billions of dollars to use as aid — a bold and widely welcomed leap in collaboration never attempted in the bloc’s history.
articles.byline: By Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Benjamin Novak

articles.headline: Airbnb Reveals Falling Revenue, With Travel Hit by Pandemic
articles.snippet: The drop was $1.2 billion for the first nine months of 2020, in the first comprehensive look at the company’s finances as it moves to go public.
articles.abstract: The drop was $1.2 billion for the first nine months of 2020, in the first comprehensive look at the company’s finances as it moves to go public.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Airbnb, the home rental service that disrupted the travel industry and was itself disrupted by the coronavirus, took a major step toward one of the year’s largest initial public offerings when it revealed declining revenue and growing losses in a prospectus on Monday.

articles.headline: Biden Calls for Stimulus Ahead of a ‘Dark Winter’ for the Country
articles.snippet: The president-elect looked to forge unity between business and unions in a speech on the economy.
articles.abstract: The president-elect looked to forge unity between business and unions in a speech on the economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. warned on Monday of a “very dark winter” ahead and called on Congress to pass a large economic stimulus package immediately to help workers, businesses, and state and local governments struggling to cope with the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: Trump Sought Options for Attacking Iran to Stop Its Growing Nuclear Program
articles.snippet: The president was dissuaded from moving ahead with a strike by advisers who warned that it could escalate into a broader conflict in his last weeks in office.
articles.abstract: The president was dissuaded from moving ahead with a strike by advisers who warned that it could escalate into a broader conflict in his last weeks in office.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump asked senior advisers in an Oval Office meeting on Thursday whether he had options to take action against Iran’s main nuclear site in the coming weeks. The meeting occurred a day after international inspectors reported a significant increase in the country’s stockpile of nuclear material, four current and former U.S. officials said on Monday.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt, Maggie Haberman, David E. Sanger, Helene Cooper and Lara Jakes

articles.headline: ‘More People May Die’ Because of Trump’s Transition Delay, Biden Says
articles.snippet: Adopting a graver tone, the president-elect said that President Trump’s refusal to authorize a transition could have deadly consequences.
articles.abstract: Adopting a graver tone, the president-elect said that President Trump’s refusal to authorize a transition could have deadly consequences.
articles.lead_paragraph: WILMINGTON, Del. — President-elect Joseph R. Biden Jr. on Monday sharpened his criticism of President Trump’s refusal to cooperate in an orderly transition, warning that “more people may die” from the coronavirus if the president does not agree to coordinate planning for the mass distribution of a vaccine when it becomes available.
articles.byline: By Michael Crowley and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Vaccine Unproven? No Problem in China, Where People Scramble for Shots
articles.snippet: Many say they are reassured because politicians and executives have been inoculated. But experts say the risks outweigh the benefits.
articles.abstract: Many say they are reassured because politicians and executives have been inoculated. But experts say the risks outweigh the benefits.
articles.lead_paragraph: Ethan Zhang needed to get back to work. Work was in Ivory Coast, however, and since January the global coronavirus outbreak had stranded the 26-year-old translator in mainland China.
articles.byline: By Sui-Lee Wee and Elsie Chen

articles.headline: Recession With a Difference: Women Face Special Burden
articles.snippet: Hit hard by job losses and the pandemic’s effect on schooling and child care, American women face short-term difficulties and long-term repercussions.
articles.abstract: Hit hard by job losses and the pandemic’s effect on schooling and child care, American women face short-term difficulties and long-term repercussions.
articles.lead_paragraph: For millions of working women, the coronavirus pandemic has delivered a rare and ruinous one-two-three punch.
